content.body: Chengzhong Wu: why does the import source call in v8 assert that the object is a wasm module object?
content.formatted_body: Chengzhong Wu: why does the import source call in v8 assert that the object is a wasm module object?

content.body:
> <@devsnek:matrix.org> Chengzhong Wu: why does the import source call in v8 assert that the object is a wasm module object?

Wasm module is the only type of module source at the moment
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @devsnek:matrix.org
Chengzhong Wu: why does the import source call in v8 assert that the object is a wasm module object?
Wasm module is the only type of module source at the moment

content.body: There is no host defined module source yet
* The first stage of implementation does not expose host defined module source yet

content.body: I mean it can be any object right? wasm spec defines wasm module objects but other specs can define other ones.
* I mean from a js engine perspective it can be any object right? wasm spec defines wasm module objects but other specs can define other ones.

m.new_content.body: I mean from a js engine perspective it can be any object right? wasm spec defines wasm module objects but other specs can define other ones.

content.body: Yes, it can be other objects, when itâ€™s defined in other specs.
It'd be nice if, for example, Node.js was able to support sources for .node modules even if there is no spec for it

content.formatted_body: It's the second stage in the design

content.body: * are you referring to addons? I'd doubt it will be a cross-platform feature to load an addon from memory without writing to fs.

content.body: At the moment, Node.js module loader does not support providing source for an addon `.node` module: https://nodejs.org/docs/latest/api/module.html#loadurl-context-nextload yet
